“Race” refers to physical differences that groups ... ,while “ethnicity” refers to shared culture, such as language, ancestry, practices, and beliefs.
- American Sociology Association

“The fundamental difference is that race is socially imposed and hierarchical... you have no control over your race; it’s how you’re perceived by others.” ethnicity is more fluid and crosses racial lines...
- New York University sociology professor Dalton Conley

The traditional definition of race and ethnicity is related to biological and sociological factors respectively. Race refers to a person's physical characteristics, such as bone structure and skin, hair, or eye color. Ethnicity, however, refers to cultural factors, including nationality, regional culture, ancestry, and language.
- https://www.diffen.com/
